summary.p: A representation of geometry for mesh, line, or point. Includes vertex positions, face indices, normals, colors, UVs, and custom attributes within buffers, reducing the cost of passing all this data to the GPU.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Core.BufferGeometry.Name
member.summary: Optional name of the object. Default is an empty string. It has not to be unique.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Core.BufferGeometry.Uuid
member.summary: Universal unique identifier of this object instance. It's automatically assigned Guid, so it shouldn't be edited.

summary.p: It's a base abstract class for most objects in Blazor3D. It provides functionality for manipulating objects in 3D space.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Core.Object3D.Position
member.summary: Represents the object's local position. Default is (0, 0, 0).

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Core.Object3D.Rotation
member.summary: Object's local rotation, in radians.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Core.Object3D.Scale
member.summary: Represents the object's local scale. Default is (1, 1, 1).

member.summary: Optional name of the object. Default is an empty string. It has not to be unique.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Core.Object3D.Uuid
member.summary: Universal unique identifier of this object instance. It's automatically assigned Guid, so it shouldn't be edited.

member.name: M:Blazor3D.Core.Object3D.Add(Blazor3D.Core.Object3D)

summary.p: Class for rectangular cuboid with a given 'width', 'height', and 'depth'.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.BoxGeometry.Width
member.summary: The length of the edges parallel to the X axis. Default is 1.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.BoxGeometry.Height
member.summary: The length of the edges parallel to the Y axis. Default is 1.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.BoxGeometry.Depth
member.summary: The length of the edges parallel to the Z axis. Default is 1.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.BoxGeometry.WidthSegments
member.summary: Number of segmented rectangular faces along the width of the sides. Default is 1.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.BoxGeometry.HeightSegments
member.summary: Number of segmented rectangular faces along the height of the sides. Default is 1.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.BoxGeometry.DepthSegments
member.summary: Number of segmented rectangular faces along the depth of the sides. Default is 1.

summary.p: Class for a simple shape of Euclidean geometry. It is constructed from a number of triangular segments that are oriented around a central point and extend as far out as a given radius. It is built counter-clockwise from a start angle and a given central angle. It can also be used to create regular polygons, where the number of segments determines the number of sides.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.CircleGeometry.Radius
member.summary: Radius of the circle. Default is 1.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.CircleGeometry.Segments
member.summary: Number of segments (triangles). Minimum = 3, default = 8.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.CircleGeometry.ThetaStart
member.summary: Start angle for first segment. Default is 0 (three o'clock position).

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.CircleGeometry.ThetaLength
member.summary: The central angle, often called theta, of the circular sector. The default is 2*Pi, which makes for a complete circle.

summary.p: Representing Euler Angles. Euler angles describe a rotational transformation by rotating an object on its various axes in specified amounts per axis, and a specified axis order. Iterating through a Euler instance will yield its components (x, y, z, order) in the corresponding order.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Maths.Euler.X
member.summary: The float angle of the X axis in radians. Default is 0. Optional.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Maths.Euler.Y
member.summary: The float angle of the Y axis in radians. Default is 0. Optional.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Maths.Euler.Z
member.summary: The float angle of the Z axis in radians. Default is 0. Optional.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Maths.Euler.Order
member.summary: String representing the order that the rotations are applied. Default is 'XYZ'. Must be upper case.

summary.p: Class representing a 3D vector. A 3D vector is an ordered triplet of numbers (labeled x, y, and z), which can be used to represent a number of things, such as:

ul.li: A direction, length or scale in 3D space.
Any arbitrary ordered triplet of numbers.

summary.p: Scenes allow you to set up what and where is to be rendered by Blazor3D. This is the place where you put your 3D objects and lights.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Scenes.Scene.BackGroundColor
member.summary: Scene background color. You can use web color values to set up required color. Default value is "DarkSlateBlue">
